sub_title: Clinical Project Manager at Sairopa B.V. | Clinical Research | Marketing & Communications | Co-Author of Fabulupus: How to be young, successful and fabulous (with lupus)
summary:
I am guided by the philosophy: “We are all patients” and this has driven me to excel in Clinical Research, Life-Sciences Business Consulting, and Scientific Marketing and Communications.

I am an enthusiastic, client-oriented, and hands-on clinical research manager and I have broad experience managing global Phase I-II-III clinical trials in oncology, neurology, HIV (drug delivery), Gastroenterology, Women’s Health, Quality of Life, Rare/Orphan disease and Pediatric studies in Canada, the USA and the EU. I actively contribute to the clinical research industry in diverse roles in clinical operations, including successfully coordinating large investigator-initiated trials, ensuring compliance at sites as a Clinical Research Associate (CRA) for a CRO, developing business and marketing solutions for pharmaceutical, CRO and medical device companies, and managing clinical trials at innovative biotechnology companies. Currently, I am a Clinical Project Manager at Sairopa B.V.

In addition to supporting medical research, I have strong skills in communications, (digital) marketing and branding strategies. I bring a fresh approach to communication initiatives which has helped to achieve clinical trial management goals, and I leverage my strong research background to develop compelling scientific communication tools to reach business goals.

We are all patients - and in parallel to managing ambitious clinical research studies and business projects, I became a patient advocate, writer, and entrepreneur and I co-wrote the book Fabulupus: How to be young, successful and fabulous (with lupus), to empower and educate young people with lupus to pursue their life goals while managing their chronic illness. Learn more about me, lupus, and my book at www.fabulupus.com

profile_positions.description: Byondis develops innovative medicines, including antibody-drug conjugates, in two key therapeutic areas: oncology and autoimmune diseases. The focus is to provide options for people suffering from diseases for which no adequate medical treatment has been found.
profile_positions.title: Clinical Trial Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Rainier Therapeutics (formerly BioClin) is a pioneering biotechnology company developing biologics to address medical conditions where there is significant unmet need, such as bladder cancer.  Our lead program is a human monoclonal antibody, B-701, that targets and blocks the activity of FGFR3 (fibroblast growth factor receptor 3). 

As a Senior Clinical Research Associate, my ability to foster relationships and execute tasks efficiently greatly support the clinical development programs. My coordination and communication skills ensure the proper conduct of clinical trials in accordance to plans, SOPs and GCP standards. I also support the quality management of the sites by implementing oversight actions, tracking and communications to improve compliance and enhance data outcomes. I provide input and develop study-related materials such as protocols, patient informed consent forms, tools, and study plans. I leverage my relationship-management skills to manage external vendors, ensuring that our project goals are executed smoothly, within timelines and with high-quality.
profile_positions.title: Senior Clinical Research Associate

profile_positions.description: MILabs is a leading pre-clinical and clinical imaging company creating innovative SPECT/PET/CT systems. As the Marketing & Communications Manager, I implemented the communications and digital marketing activities such as newsletters, interviews, press releases, social media messaging, brochures, emails, and videos to boost brand awareness and lead generation. I also analyzed information to create material and tactics to better engage with scientific audiences. I successfully managed vendors to creatively maximize the presence and impact of MILabs at international trade shows and conferences.
profile_positions.title: Marketing and Communications Manager

profile_positions.description:
Seuss Recruitment is the pharma recruitment specialist that finds the most synergistic fit between life-science professionals and forward-thinking pharma and biotech companies. As an Account Manager & Relationship Manager, I successfully sold recruitment services to biotechnology, healthcare incubators and CRO companies. I developed active long-term client relationships and utilized my clinical research expertise and industry knowledge to train recruiters which resulted in improved candidate search and selection for our clients. 

Furthermore, I coordinated the launch of the Seuss Recruitment brand and developed and implemented the purpose-driven marketing initiatives. I managed the websites, content creation, blog writing and social media channels and this was instrumental to boosting brand awareness and with engaging professionals in the life-sciences industry.
profile_positions.title: Relationship Manager

profile_positions.description:
Seuss Consulting creates pragmatic, creative and relationship-based business solutions for pharmaceutical, biotechology, medical device companies as well CRO & specialty suppliers. As the second person hired at Seuss Consulting, I was a pivotal member of the company and my project management and marketing skills, along with my infectious energy and enthusiasm, helped launch and grow this innovative start-up life-sciences consulting company. 

As a Account Manager, I was successful in securing new business with pharma, biotech and CRO clients. In my role as a Business Consultant, I developed and coordinated the processes for; 1) Pharmaceutical sponsors to select their CRO partners for clinical trial projects, 2) Global CROs to expand their clinical operations in new countries, and 3) Optimizing business development strategies for CRO/Suppliers in the life-science industry. I delivered superior client service and support which resulted in repeat business and long-term partnerships. 

I also helped increase the growth of Seuss Consulting (along with sub-brands Seuss Recruitment and Zocket) by coordinating and implementing marketing strategies including brand development,  website creation and optimization, content creation and curation and social media messaging activities, which resulted in increased brand recognition and higher SEO. I produced over 100 blogs  and developed strong storytelling skills (I myself authored over 75  of these purpose-driven, informative  and blogs) to inspire, inform and engage our audience of life-sciences professionals.
profile_positions.title: Account Manager & Business Consultant

company.name: Fabulupus: How to be young, successful and fabulous (with lupus)

profile_positions.company: Fabulupus: How to be young, successful and fabulous (with lupus)
profile_positions.description:
Fabulupus is the first and only book written specifically to help young people with lupus. Authors Jodie and Jessica were diagnosed with lupus when they were 13 and 26 respectively. They know what you’re going through and they know the challenges that you may face. They also know that you can accomplish your goals and have an amazing life. Unlike other books about lupus, this book focuses on the life stuff and was written for young people with lupus by young people with lupus. Using their personal experiences, Jodie and Jessica provide the “tips and tricks” that helped them to survive, succeed and be fabulous (with lupus).

www.fabulupus.com
profile_positions.title: Author

profile_positions.description:
• Conducted regional site monitoring visits and site management activities, including site training, source document review, EDC monitoring, GCP compliance, site correspondence, and reporting 
• Liaised between sponsor and clinical sites for study updates, data queries, newsletters and overall study management issues
• Conducted detailed protocol review to develop informative study tools, instructional material and to train colleagues on the studies
• Refined enrollment strategies, developed creative recruitment tools, and successfully met enrollment objectives for various projects 
• Managed CTMS functionality in conjunction with the documents department to ensure regulatory and GCP compliance 
• Developed content and generated study-wide newsletters to provide important trial updates and key enrollment goals 
• Effective communication skills resulted in clear, and informative monitoring reports delivered on time, therefore specifically requested to monitor clinical sites that needed additional guidance 
• Valuable team player consistently praised for pro-actively creating innovative strategies, diplomatically engaging with sites and sponsors, meeting trial deliverables and giving superior client service
profile_positions.title: Clinical Research Associate (CRA) and Site Monitor

profile_positions.description:
• Coordinated a large-scale, multi-national, Phase III breast cancer drug trial (and multiple sub-studies) with 7576 patients
• Responsibilities included: trial administration, ensuring protocol compliance, monitoring toxicity and verifying patient response to treatment, completing all regulatory requirements, and augmenting the quality and consistency of a large data set 
• Communicated with hundreds of sites in the United States and internationally, and several co-operative groups to facilitate the flow of accurate data, drugs, and trial information
• Directed the work activities of 7 staff members, coordinated with trial support personnel to meet all scientific and operational objectives, and motivated the teams to meet deadlines
• Successfully closed the trial through operational difficulties and thoroughly orchestrated trial analyses by delivering a complete and accurate data set, for both an interim and final analysis
profile_positions.title: Study Coordinator (Clinical Trial Coordinator and Lead CRA)

profile_positions.description:
• Assessed eligibility, treatment outcomes, consent forms, supporting documentation, tumor criteria and audit findings for a large cohort of patients using various data systems including Oracle and Oracle Clinical
• Developed decision-making capabilities, and the ability to prioritize among many competing demands in addition to strengthening analytical skills to support the collection and processing of complicated data sets
• Initiated additional projects (beyond what was required) to improve data quality
• Promptly promoted to be the Study Coordinator of the trial
profile_positions.title: Research Associate

volunteer_experiences.description:
• Initiated several innovative fundraising strategies, including obtaining financial support from several Bay Area businesses and organizing a charity baby fashion show 
• Creative problem-solving skills and tenacity were proven by successfully raising over three thousand dollars since joining the small non-profit organization
• Provided tactical guidance and fundraising strategies and  as a board of directors member
